intro: Lepturus rottboellii, commonly known as the slender sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to sandy and rocky soils in the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its prostrate habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is adapted to harsh, dry environments and is often found in open habitats such as dunes and sand plains. Lepturus rottboellii is an important component of coastal and inland sand ecosystems.
